contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Senator | name=Augustus S. Porter | image=Augustus Porter.jpg | imagesize=200 | jr/sr=United States Senator | state=[[Michigan]] | party=[[United States Whig Party|Whig]] | term=January 20, 1840 – March 4, 1845 | preceded=[[Lucius Lyon]] | succeeded=[[Lewis Cass]] | office2=[[Mayor of Detroit]] | term2=1838-1839 | preceded2=[[Henry Howard (Detroit)|Henry Howard]] | succeeded2=[[Asher B. Bates]] | birth_date={{birth date|1798|1|18}} | birth_place=[[Canandaigua (city), New York|Canandaigua, New York]] | death_date={{death date and age|1872|9|18|1798|1|18}} | death_place=[[Niagara Falls, New York]] | spouse= | alma_mater = [[Union College]] | profession=[[Lawyer]] }} '''Augustus Seymour Porter''' (January 18, 1798{{spaced ndash}}September 18, 1872) was a [[United States|U.S.]] [[politician|statesman]] from the state of [[Michigan]]. He was born in [[Canandaigua (city), New York|Canandaigua, New York]], the nephew of [[Peter Buell Porter]] and attended [[Canandaigua Academy]].<ref name = "cong">{{CongBio|inline=1|P000437}}</ref> He graduated from [[Union College]], in [[Schenectady, New York]], in 1818, studied law and was admitted to the [[Bar association|bar]] and commenced practice in [[Detroit, Michigan]]. He was treasurer of the Michigan Pioneer Society in 1837.<ref name = "cong"/> He became the recorder of Detroit in 1830 and was [[List of mayors of Detroit, Michigan|mayor of Detroit]] in 1838.<ref name = "cong"/> He resigned as mayor to run for the Senate, and was succeeded as mayor by [[Asher B. Bates]].<ref name = "cong"/> He was elected as a [[United States Whig Party|Whig]] to the [[United States Senate]], and served from January 20, 1840 until March 4, 1845. He did not run for reelection in 1844.<ref name = "cong"/> He was chairman of the [[Committee on Roads and Canals]], 1841–1845, and was on the [[Committee on Enrolled Bills]], 1841–1843.<ref name = "cong"/> He moved to his father’s residence in [[Niagara Falls, New York]], in 1848 and died at there on September 18, 1872. He is interred in [[Oakwood Cemetery (Niagara Falls, NY)|Oakwood Cemetery]] in [[Niagara Falls, New York]].<ref name = "pg">{{cite web|title = The Political Graveyard| url=http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/porter1.html#R9M0J9RW4| accessdate = September 14, 2010| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20100826045919/http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/porter1.html| archivedate= 26 August 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Portal|Biography}} * {{Find a Grave|7249500}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|us-sen}} {{U.S. Senator box | state=Michigan | class=1 | before=[[Lucius Lyon]] | after=[[Lewis Cass]] | alongside=[[John Norvell]], [[William Woodbridge]] | years=1840–1845}} {{s-end}} {{USSenMI}} {{DetroitMayors}} {{Authority control|VIAF=29349868}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Porter, Augustus Seymour | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = January 18, 1798 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Canandaigua (city), New York|Canandaigua, New York]] | DATE OF DEATH = September 18, 1872 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[Niagara Falls, New York]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Porter, Augustus Seymour}} [[Category:1798 births]] [[Category:1872 deaths]] [[Category:Mayors of Detroit, Michigan]] [[Category:United States Senators from Michigan]] [[Category:Union College (New York) alumni]] [[Category:People from Canandaigua, New York]] [[Category:People from Niagara Falls, New York]] [[Category:Michigan Whigs]] [[Category:Whig Party United States Senators]] [[Category:People from Niagara County, New York]] {{Michigan-mayor-stub}}
